Package hammer.api

The classes and interfaces that make up the API surface of the Hammer framework.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Container
    A Container represents a partially constructed configuration that will eventually be used to build a new Injector.
    Container.BindingInvocation<T>
    A Container.BindingInvocation is a configuration entity used to configure the binding of an implementation type or instance that has been added to a Container.
    Container.ListMemberBinder<T>
    A Container.ListMemberBinder is a configuration entity used to used to configure the binding of an implementation type or instance that has been added to a Container and bind it as a value in an injectable List.
    Container.MapMemberBinder<V>
    A Container.MapMemberBinder is a configuration entity used to used to configure the binding of an implementation type or instance that has been added to a Container and bind it as a value in an injectable Map.
    Container.MapMemberKeyBinder<K>
    A Container.MapMemberKeyBinder is a configuration entity used to used to configure the key to use for a specific implementation type or instance that has been added to a Container as a value in an injectable Map.
    Container.QualifierBinder
    An Container.QualifierBinder is a configuration entity used to used to configure the binding of an implementation type or instance that has been added to a Container and bind only to injection requests annotated with a specific Qualifier annotation.
    Container.SetMemberBinder<T>
    A Container.SetMemberBinder is a configuration entity used to used to configure the binding of an implementation type or instance that has been added to a Container and bind it as a value in an injectable Set.
    Container.StrictBinder<T>
    A Container.StrictBinder is a configuration entity used to used to configure the binding of an implementation type or instance that has been added to a Container and bind it to a specific injectable type or set of injectable types.
    Injector
    An Injector is a JSR-330 compliant dependency injection tool.
    Loader
    A Loader is responsible for loading type bindings into a Container.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Hammer
    The entry point for the Hammer framework.
    Hammer.Token
    A utility class used to protect access to creating internal Injectors.
    Qualifiers
    Utility class used to work with Qualifier annotations.
    Scopes
    Utility class used to work with Scope annotations.
    TypeToken<T>
    A TypeToken is used to combat type erasure and allow introspection of parameterized types.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    InjectionType
    An enumeration of the supported injection types by Injectors.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    InjectionException
    Thrown when an injection attempt fails while trying to create an instance with an injectable constructor or while invoking an injectable method.
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    Multiton
    A Multiton is a special type of @Scope annotation that is given special semantic meaning when used with an Injector.

Package hammer.api Description

The classes and interfaces that make up the API surface of the Hammer framework.
